data.title: In 1913, future President Herbert Hoover and his wife, Lou Henry Hoover, bought a California summer home from her parents for a $500 gold...
data.meta_description:
338 likes, 2 comments - wsjrealestate on June 28, 2023: "In 1913, future President Herbert Hoover and his wife, Lou Henry Hoover, bought a California summer home from her parents for a $500 gold piece. Located in Monterey, about a mile from the bay, the Shingle-style wooden cottage stayed in the family‚Äîthe Hoovers tracked their sons‚Äô growth with pencil marks on the dining room wall‚Äîuntil the mid-1940s, historical documents show. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Now, the property, known as the Henry-Hoover Cottage, is coming on the market for $2.395 million, according to listing agent Ben Beesley of Keller Williams Coastal Estates, who is marketing the property with colleague Shannon Highfield. ‚Å†
‚Å†
The sellers are Steven Moore, 62, and Suzanne Worcester, 58, professors at California State University Monterey Bay, who bought the home for $1.3 million in 2016 after living on-campus for about 20 years. ‚ÄúThere was fine print on the housing agreement that said we couldn‚Äôt stay there after we retired,‚Äù said Moore. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Read more at the link in @wsjrealestate's bio.‚Å†
